sentences.english: The voyeur stayed behind the window of the girls' bathroom.
sentences.chinese: 那個偷窺狂站在女生浴室的窗戶旁邊。

sentences.english: I think he is one of these people who is a voyeur .
We can be sure there will be more "peeping Toms" in the future.
sentences.chinese: 我們可以確信未來將會有更多的偷窺狂。

sentences.english: The court papers allege she may be a voyeur.
sentences.chinese: 法庭文件宣稱她可能是一個偷窺狂。

sentences.english: As a "peeping Tom", one ought to be satisfied this time.
sentences.chinese: 一個偷窺狂，這一次絕對有飽足欲。

sentences.english: The guy is a peeping Tom.

definition: see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
to drown sb in a wicker basket, a form of 沉潭[chen2 tan2]
to puff up/to swell up/to inflate/to blow air into sth/(fig.) to encourage/to support
armpit/also pr. [ge1 zhi5 wo1]/also written 夾肢窩|夹肢窝[ga1 zhi5 wo1]
to claw wildly/to scratch frantically/to arrest people indiscriminately
weary old body (colloquial term, used jocularly or irreverently)
lit. rarely seen, very strange (idiom); to express amazement due to lack of experience/naive expression of excitement due to ignorance
to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
